website_summaries.verdict: Tapered replacement hammer handle that's available in multiple lengths for convenience.
pros: Handle is a high quality American hickory, which both looks great and performs well, especially considering the price
Has a sharp-looking quality of grain in the handle
Contains all of the pieces you need to attach the head to the new handle
Available in lengths between 10 and 16 inches
Made for hammers from 8 to 12 ounces, so it's versatile
cons: Some problems with build quality and shipping quality on a few models

customer_reviews.title: handle, replacement for ball pein hammer
customer_reviews.text: I hate to throw away old tools. It seems the older the tool, the better the steel. I had an old ball pein hammer head that only needed a new handle. So many of the big box hardware stores no longer sell replacement handles. Glad to see Amazon offers these items. The wood on the replacement handle is tight grained and sealed with a clear coating. I had to trim the new handle to fit into the hammer head and used a bench grinder to profile the shape for a tight fit. The handle seems to be of good quality and should last for as long as I need.
customer_reviews.author: captain moore

customer_reviews.title: It's a Handle (......and they did it right)!
customer_reviews.text: It's a handle. No cracks, no defects. Says made in USA. Came with two wood wedges and one metal ribbed wedge. Fit my old craftsman 14 oz (!) (yes, 14, weighed it) head so tightly I could barely get the metal wedge in. It's the kind of handle that you used to find in every hardware store, but seems to have disappeared. Will definitely buy this brand again for other fixer upper tool projects.
customer_reviews.author: Pugnacious Middle Aged Male

customer_reviews.title: adequate,for the price.  not first quality.
customer_reviews.text: review of the 16 inch ball pein handles. thinking that these are probably manufacturer's 2nds that are mass dumped at Amazon. the price is seriously cheap so you get a fair return on value. Of the 3 I bought, 2 had the grain in the wrong orientation and the 3rd had a 15 degree bend in the neck of the handle. Guess that works if you are right handed. finish is fine and no defects in the hickory itself. It will work for a ball pein, but I'd be much more selective if replacing a maul or sledge handle.
customer_reviews.author: m.alger

customer_reviews.title: Decent handle for the price. Met my needs.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 14” handle for 16oz -24oz ball-peen handle. I got the cheapest option at $8 i think it said “contractor grade”. I am a contractor, not a machinist, so this handle worked fine for my 16oz estwing ball-peen head. The grain was pretty close to parallel with the swing, and the slot cut in the top was off center. And i had to file it down quite a bit in order for it to fit, But im happy with it because you get what you pay for, and for 8$ it met my needs.
customer_reviews.author: marcula

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste time replacing a hammer handle
customer_reviews.text: The next time a handle breaks on my hammer I’ll just buy a new one and trash the old head. After removing the old handle remains from the head I installed the new handle. The base of the new handle splintered as I was driving it on so I threw everything out. Will never replace a handle again
customer_reviews.author: ekirkley

customer_reviews.title: Item OK but take care fitting
customer_reviews.text: Nice handle for a small ball pein hammer I have had for many years that previously belonged to my father. Unfortunately the wood is somewhat brittle and split when I drove the metal wedge in to secure the head. Recommend that you cut a fine slot first in the top of the handle (I knew I should have but was lazy and didn't) which should help prevent the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Parkway

customer_reviews.title: A decent replacement hammer handle
customer_reviews.text: The handle I received was finished nicely and included wood and metal wedges. It fit a ball peen hammer head I had lying about. I had to extend the top cut for the wood wedge with a hand saw because the hammer opening was a bit oversize, causing the wedge end to protrude more than normal.
customer_reviews.author: JamesTop Contributor: Fountain Pens

customer_reviews.title: Hickory Handles Ball Pein Machinist Hammer Handle
customer_reviews.text: After visiting family in LA I fell in love with hickory hammer handles. I had a few old hammer heads from my father’s estate that I wanted to resurrect. Hickory hammer handles are available in Australia, but the grain seems very plain compared to the beautiful grain in the handles I just bought through this web site. Hickory I believe is the best anti-shock / vibration hammer handle there is. I will be handing down to my daughter two show piece hammers. Thank you, guys, because there are many US sites that don't post to Australia and you do. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The one I got was cracked
customer_reviews.text: Before I put it on i found a vertica crack. Very disappointing from a American company. Not practical during this shut down to return. Maybe i just got a bad one, or that it won't matter because the crack is at the head end, but i felt kinda bad.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: it is nice to be able to repair it I broke one ...
customer_reviews.text: The cost of tools today , when you break one ,it is nice to be able to repair it I broke one of my hammer handles so i went to the store to buy one , but no one has this just a new hammer, so back to amazon and found it . I ordered the handle , the price with shipping was better than store shopping . When i received the handle I installed it in the hammer,,it fit the head excellent,was easy to install ,feels , looks and works like a new hammer. Good price ,Easy to install Works like New . Thanks again amazon
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: It's bigger than stated
customer_reviews.text: Nice well made, solid handle. Unfortunately, the size is off. It is closer to 1" length and 1/2" in width. Too big for my picture framing hammer 8oz. head.
customer_reviews.author: Mantracker

customer_reviews.title: I like these a lot better than the polyurethane coated handles
customer_reviews.text: I like these a lot better than the polyurethane coated handles! Easy to remove the wax and apply a nice oil finish. Attached a photo of this handle mounted to an old 16oz Oak Leaf brand ball pein hammer and coated with boiled linseed oil. There was a lot of filing involved because the eye of this hammer was not a standard modern size. I recommend searching for and viewing the Link Handle catalog in pdf. It was very helpful in my selection process because these listings do not contain much information.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Solid quality
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice handle feels solid and a nice medium weight to it. Good thing it came with the wood wedge and metal barb wedge or else ID have to make it. I've been abusing it for about a month now and its still tight and hasn't come loose. I really love the fact it doesn't have that ugly hard clear coat on it. It feels like I could swing all day and not get a blister. It also means because its only wax it does get dirty which I don't mind. In the picture is my own 18oz hammer head i made
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Harper

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: They work fine. Just like any other type handles a little sanding to make them work. I would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality and functional hammer handle.
customer_reviews.text: Solid piece of wood and works like a charm! Handle came with multiple wedges. What else is there to say?
customer_reviews.author: Zen's Big Bang

customer_reviews.title: Made well.
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Good grain orientation. Fit well as a replacement handle.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Page

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Very soft sapwood with an awful twist to the handle. It works, but far from a perfect handle.
customer_reviews.author: Scott K.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Just as advertised. No issues there, but wish it was stained and not raw.
customer_reviews.author: Jason K

customer_reviews.title: Quality item
customer_reviews.text: Replacement handle for my grandfather's ball pein hammer head. Good quality handle
customer_reviews.author: Barth

customer_reviews.title: Fit well
customer_reviews.text: Fit well had to do a little trimming not a lot since it was for two different size hammers I Thought it was good
customer_reviews.author: John S.Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable
customer_reviews.text: Handle was ok. However grain was horrible. Would have been unusable if it needed to be used with a heavyweight hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Moline Girl

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and fit.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like hardware stores no longer carry replacement handles, so I was glad to find this one. Seems to be made of good quality wood and I expect it to outlast me.
customer_reviews.author: Ron C.

customer_reviews.title: could only find a replacement handle at Amazon
customer_reviews.text: needed this handle to replace a broken handle on a favorite hammer
customer_reviews.author: oldman

customer_reviews.title: Hammer handle
customer_reviews.text: Used to replace broken hammer handle. Seems to be good quality
customer_reviews.author: Tom Jellings

customer_reviews.title: Good strong handle
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect handle replacement for a silversmithing hammer. I used a 3M pad to remove the shine and improve the surface.
customer_reviews.author: Terje Persen

customer_reviews.title: Quality handle
customer_reviews.text: Quality replacement handle. Although the size was note correct (my bad) The return was more than fair.
customer_reviews.author: Tom S

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Put my Dad's 60 year old machine hammers pack in service.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Hill

customer_reviews.title: poor fit to hammer; not as robust as expected.
customer_reviews.text: The handle is rather thin and the fit was less than perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Paul J. Pallanich

customer_reviews.title: Not too good
customer_reviews.text: Handles were received with splinters and rough finish. I had to sand them down to remove the roughness. Also, these were not "wax finished as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Steve A

customer_reviews.title: Fabricated to fit.
customer_reviews.text: Had to shave it a bit to fit my head but now it’s on and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Hartman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice solid handle. Wedge was included which was a pleasant surprise.
customer_reviews.author: Bullhart

customer_reviews.title: and good wood/grain direction
customer_reviews.text: Came just as described. Straight, shaped well, and good wood/grain direction. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Clint C.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would be smaller but ill use it for a bigger regular hammer...
customer_reviews.author: dh

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Better than I expected. I restored an old hammer and can use it again.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Sartor

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: very nice handle did not fit my itty bitty hammer head return went smooth
customer_reviews.author: Robin ML

customer_reviews.title: Not an original replacement
customer_reviews.text: This handle was purchased as a replacement for a Plumb 40 oz engineer hammer. The original is maroon in color. This handle is natural varnished hickory and is for a ball peen hammer. It will not fit the Plumb hammer. The picture posted looks like the original handle, but the product is not like the handle shown in the picture. Very unhappy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Harry P

customer_reviews.title: Pictures can be deceiving.
customer_reviews.text: What I ordered is not what I needed, or wanted. I was looking for a handle to fit an old finish hammer. The description seemed okay , and, the picture was a match. What I received was a handle for a child's hand , or, a small hammer. The supplier was never involved the decision process to buy, so, I got what I got. I'm not displeased with the vendor, but, with Amazon. They just throw anything out there to make a buck. Do your homework, and, make educated decisions. Don't let Amazon do it for you. They don't know, and, don't always have the facts,or info you need. I did it to myself by thinking they knew.
customer_reviews.author: carlson305

product_meta.title: Link Handles 65541 Ball Pein Machinist Handle for 8 to 12 oz. Hammers, 12" Length, Wax Finish, Contractor Grade
product_meta.description: Size:12" Length| Style:Model 403-04 for 8 to 12 oz. hammersEach handle comes with the required wedges, rivets, or epoxy needed for proper application to the tool head. Quality Level Codes: 04 Better quality American hickory with a wax, 09 promotional grade handles, American Hickory, 19-Better quality American hickory with a clear lacquer finish.
feature_bullets: For 8 to 12 oz. hammers, Eye 3/4" x 7/16"
